main event: Two witnesses observed a red-orange object in Uniontown, Pennsylvania, that disappeared to the south.
interesting points: The object was reported to be about the size of a satellite but was larger and faster than a typical satellite,The sighting lasted for about 3 seconds,The observers stated the object followed their fixed gaze before disappearing,The color of the object was described as red-orange,The witnesses estimated the speed of the object to be around 300 to 400 mph.
witness description: Daniel Tryon and his wife, both of whom had experience with telescopes and observational techniques.
